digital-experience-healthcare/contact.ht.overview: The contact page for Digital Experience Healthcare provides users with a form to reach out for inquiries or support, displays contact information, and includes success/error banners for form submission feedback. It features a responsive navigation bar, accessibility enhancements, and a theme toggle.

interactions: Click skip link to jump to main content
Toggle dark/light mode via theme toggle button
Submit contact form and trigger success or error banners
Dismiss banners using close buttons
Navigate via navbar links

Form submission triggers client-side validation
On success, success banner is shown and form resets
On failure, error banner is displayed with retry option
Dismiss actions hide banners

ARIA roles for navigation and alerts
aria-live regions for dynamic banners
aria-labels on interactive elements (theme toggle, close buttons)
Semantic headings and landmark elements

digital-experience-healthcare/main.js.overview: Framework-free JavaScript powering interactive and accessible behaviors for a healthcare website, including theme toggling, navigation highlighting, back-to-top control, skip-to-content accessibility, CTA analytics, and toast notifications.
key_components: Theme toggle system with localStorage persistence
Back-to-top button with scroll visibility logic
CTA buttons for services and contact
interactions: Click theme toggle to switch between light/dark themes
Scroll to trigger back-to-top visibility
Click back-to-top to smooth scroll to top
Click skip-to-content to focus main content
Navbar links highlight based on current route
Click CTA buttons to log analytics events
Show and hide toast messages with auto-dismiss and manual close
routes: Dynamic detection of current pathname for navbar highlighting
CTA links likely route to /services and /contact
No explicit SPA routing; relies on standard navigation
data_flow: Theme preference stored and retrieved from localStorage
Analytics events pushed to window.analyticsLog array
Toast messages dynamically created and appended to DOM
Scroll and click events trigger UI updates and analytics logging
accessibility: Skip-to-content link focuses main content and supports keyboard users
Back-to-top button toggles aria-hidden for visibility state
Toast uses role='status' and aria-live='polite' for screen reader announcements
Navbar uses aria-current='page' for active link indication
Respects prefers-reduced-motion for smooth scrolling
analytics: window.analyticsLog array stores all event payloads with timestamps
test_ideas: Verify theme toggle updates DOM attribute, localStorage, and logs analytics event

Confirm prefers-reduced-motion disables smooth scrolling animations
Assert accessibility attributes (aria-current, aria-hidden, role, aria-live) are correctly applied
